body.description: Introducing Charmin Toilet Paper for Commercial Use! Provide your guests with a noticeably softer bathroom experience. With 40% thicker and 40% more absorbent toilet paper rolls, Charmin is long-lasting and a better value for your business than the leading premium commercial bathroom tissue. Charmin Commercial Toilet Paper Rolls are perfect for hospitality, restaurants, and other businesses that want to provide more softness and strength for a superior guest experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly What It SAYS It Is
reviews.reviewText: If I see one more review caterwauling about these BUSINESS (professional) bulk TP's not being as good as the "real" thing... etc etc etc OMG! Well, here's a reality check: Virtually ALL "Professional" bulk TP, regardless of name brand, are essentially the same; and for a very specific reason. These similarities include: 2ply very thin, non-plush, non-premium paper. Individual tissue-wrapped rolls of approx 450-500 sheets. WHY??? Perhaps you have noticed that the general public tends to treat restrooms that aren't their own like.... well, like CRAP. If these rolls were the plush, thick, luxurious smooch-yer-butt heavenliness some have apparently grown accustomed to, businesses would literally be forced to hire an on-scene, in-house clogged toilet overflow plumber along with a sanitation floor cleaning service. These (professional) rolls rarely clog as it takes about 6 times the square footage of TP to accomplish it. There are some exceptions, of course.... such as Professional Premium Grades aimed at upper-end hotels, etc. So, actually KNOW what you are buying! Words like "professional" are printed on there for a reason, not simply to be blissfully ignored!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good value, great product!
reviews.reviewText: This product was a good price and good quality - it's a win/win!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than comparable options
reviews.reviewText: Definitely not the Charmin you buy at the grocery store.... It is thick and soft with no pleating..... Significantly better than the other bulk "professional" brands I've purchased at the same price range and will last a household a very long time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very very thin!
reviews.reviewText: Not as abrasive as other commercial products but very thin!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Soft and doesn’t clog private septic systems
reviews.reviewText: For the value this stuff is amazing. Since it’s made for commercial applications it breaks down much faster in the septic system. Regular Charming and most home owner toilet papers kept clogging our system. This never has. Plus each roll is individually wrapped. Best for private septic systems!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars This is not ultra soft by any stretch of the imagination
reviews.reviewText: If color of packaging were an indicator, this would appear to be the ultra-thick, ultra-soft Charmin. It is not. It is a cheap, 2 ply. And now I have a heck of a lot of it to go through. Sure, it might be a step up from 1-ply, splinters included for free, abrasive commercial paper. But it is not what I had hoped for. I won't be buying it again. My butt, and the butts belonging to those who stay at my short-term rental, deserve better.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good value for the money
reviews.reviewText: I live in a home of 5-7 people depending on the month and which kid feels like they can live on their own for awhile. I try to charge rent, because, you know. But kids. What can you do?Anyway, we took a vote. For me, I'd just buy industrial TP & paper towels, but that was a no-go in the house. This is what we voted on. So it's been on auto-refill every 2-3 months. I can't complain. They meet the needs and seems like a good value.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Terrible! Not like rest super thin not absorbent falls apart!
reviews.reviewText: This was awful it falls apart at the tiniest bit of liquid you have to layer it up like a 100 times and it still falls apart! I can't even believe it! I didn't realize it was different than the regular charmin essentials, but when I got it it was individual and it was the crap stuff like worse than the ones you find in the store restrooms! I didn't need to open the box until it was too late to return it so now I'm stuck with it:(
Great value for the money especially these days, don't know if the price has changed. I'm still going through it. will re-order when needed, cheaper than the stores

reviews.reviewTitle: Plastic-free!!! & best commercial-quality product I've tried so far
reviews.reviewText: I've tried a bunch of different commercial toilet papers for my home in search of the best plastic-free toilet paper option and this one has captured my heart.Most of the other bulk/commercial toilet papers have a bit of a waxy or harsh feel to them, but this one is much softer! I was surprised at first how thin it is and as others have noted it's definitely not your typical Charmin product, but it's so strong and durable while introducing a softness I haven't encountered in other plastic-free toilet papers. I will definitely be ordering this as long as it's available.Only downside was the box it shipped in was comically large, but well-worth it to me to get a superior, plastic-free product like this. Happy wiping! :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Didn't realize the difference between commercial grade toilet paper til now.
reviews.reviewText: Quality: poorThickness: supposedly it's double ply, but I have seen single ply that might be thicker than this.Value: cheaper for the per roll, but there's a reason why. So unless you're looking to use it to trash someone's house, I would suggest looking else where.Overall: unless this was the only type left, I would not buy this again. I would recommend it to my enemies.
Very much feels like Commercial toilet paper; not like the regular one you buy at the store. The thinnest two ply you could ever imagine.
